numlitem.para: Inoperative reverser is secured in forward thrust position, and
Appropriate performance adjustments are applied.

note.para: No performance adjustments required on UPS aircraft.
During landing roll-out, differential braking may be required to maintain directional control.

numlitem.para: Asymmetrical reverse thrust may be used. Use normal reversing procedures and techniques. If it appears that rudder authority is becoming limited during deceleration, return lever to reverse idle detent.
Land and Hold Short Operations (LAHSO) prohibited.
Downgrade aircraft dispatch category status to CAT 3a.
Land and Hold Short Operations (LAHSO) prohibited.
No dispatch with any reverser message displayed for operative reverser.

note.para: Must be operative for dispatch into LPB, UIO, BOG, GUA,TGU.

placard.para: Placard affected Reverser Thrust Lever "REVERSER INOP" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.title: Thrust Reversers
maintenance.para: Deferral of this item requires downgrading to the status indicated in the A/C STATUS DISPATCH column below.

note.para: Dispatch is permitted with one or both sync-locks inoperative provided sync-locks are verified inoperative in the "locked" position. The following verification of inoperative sync-locks does not need to be performed if it is known the sync-locks are operating normally.

maintenance.para: Verification of sync-lock in locked position:

numlitem.para: Open fan cowl panels per AMM 71-11-04-2.

caution.para: DO NOT USE AN EXTENSION BAR OR OTHER TOOLS TO MOVE THE UNLOCK LEVER. IF YOU USE AN EXTENSION BAR OR OTHER TOOLS, DAMAGE TO THE UNLOCK LEVER OR ACTUATOR CAN OCCUR.

numlitem.para: Operate the unlock handle on the thrust reverser locking actuator to the unlocked position, and then release.
Verify that both left and right translating sleeves do not move aft more than approximately one sixteenth of an inch.
Deactivate the thrust reverser per the normal procedure.

maintenance.para: Normal Deactivation of Inoperative Thrust Reverser:

numlitem.para: Open fan cowl panels per AMM 71-11-04-2.
Open aft fairing access door.
Obtain isolation valve deactivation pin B78001-3 (part of B78001-2 Dispatch Kit) from the nacelle stowage location or the fly-away equipment stowage container in the forward cargo compartment.
Install deactivation pin in the manual lockout hole on the thrust reverser isolation valve and install cotter pin or lockwire.
Depress the bypass valve handle on the thrust reverser isolation valve and install a streamered deactivation pin (0.125 inch diameter X 1.1 inch, part of B78001-1 lock assembly).

note.para: The streamer pins and the hitch pins are found in the deactivation pin container on the forward surface of the isolation valve (if installed).

numlitem.para: If the sleeve is extended, turn manual drive with 3/8 inch square drive to retract per AMM 78-31-00-2. Manual cranking of the sleeve will return sleeve to within approximately 0.75 inch of the stowed position.

note.para: The manual drive has an override clutch which limits the amount of torque that can be applied. Due to seal forces, the clutch will ratchet before the sleeve is fully retracted and locking is complete.

numlitem.para: Remove the two thrust reverser sleeve plugs. Loosen the primary deactivation eyebolt nut until the eyebolt can be aligned with the hole in the thrust reverser sleeve.
Remove the two deactivation pins from the stowage position below the center hydraulic actuator. Install the sleeve plugs in the deactivation pin stowage position.
Perform the following to unlock the sync-locks.
Verify that the following circuit breakers are closed:
AIR/GND SYS 1 (11S15)
AIR/GND SYS 2 (11S19)
LANDING GEAR POS SYS 1 (11C30)
LANDING GEAR POS SYS 2 (11C23)
SYNC-LOCK-L or SYNC-LOCK-R (L=6C12 or R=6D12)
Supply electrical power (Ref AMM 24-22-00).
Raise the left (right) reverse thrust lever to the deploy position.
Install primary deactivation pin through the thrust reverser sleeve into the primary deactivation eyebolt.

caution.para: MAKE SURE THAT THE MANUAL DRIVE IS FULLY ENGAGED WITH THE SYNC-LOCK DRIVE SHAFT BEFORE ROTATION AND THAT IT STAYS FULLY ENGAGED DURING THE FULL ROTATION. IF THE MANUAL DRIVE IS NOT FULLY ENGAGED, DAMAGE TO THE SYNC-LOCK CAN OCCUR.

numlitem.para: Tighten the primary deactivation eyebolt nut to retract the thrust reverser sleeve until the secondary deactivation pin can be installed through the thrust reverser sleeve into the torque box structure.

note.para: If the sync-locks cannot be electrically unlocked per step 9, it will be necessary to unlock the sync-lock manually by engaging the manual drive and rotating the manual drive in the stow direction while at the same time tightening the primary deactivation eyebolt nut.

numlitem.para: Verify the locking feature on the deactivation pins and/or captive nuts as follows:
Fully engage the deactivation pin in the thrust reverser captive nut.
Measure the "breakaway" torque value as the deactivation pin is rotated in the remove direction until the locking feature on the pin and/or nut is disengaged.

note.para: There should be no axial load on the captive nut when the torque is measured.

numlitem.para: Make sure the deactivation pin and/or captive nut have a minimum breakaway torque of 18 inch-pounds.
If the deactivation pin and captive nut combination include a breakaway torque of less than 18 inch-pounds, replace the deactivation pin and/or captive nut as necessary.
Tighten both deactivation pins to 120 to 150 pound-inches.
Repeat steps 6-15 for the opposite reverser sleeve.
Move the left (right) reverse thrust lever to the stow position.
Remove the streamered pin from the bypass valve handle on the thrust reverser isolation valve allowing the valve to return to its normally closed position.
Close aft fairing access door.
Close fan cowl panels per AMM 71-11-04-2.
Open and collar the appropriate SYNC-LOCK circuit breakers. For the left engine, the L ENG SYNC-CONTROL (6C12). For the right engine, the R ENG SYNC-LOCK CONTROL (6D12).
Verify thrust control operates normally:
Prior to engine start, move the EEC POWER switch on the EEC Maintenance Panel (P61) to the ALTN position.
Advance thrust levers to the full forward position.
Verify that the Thrust Level Resolver (TLR) measurements on the EICAS EPCS page read between 80 - 83 degrees for associated engine.

note.para: If the angle is not in the given range, then adjust the control rod(s) per AMM 76-11-00-5.

numlitem.para: Move the thrust levers to the idle position.
Verify that the TLR measurements on the EICAS EPCS page read 38.0 +/- 0.2 degrees.

note.para: If the angle is not in the given range, then adjust the control rod(s) per AMM 76-11-00-5.

numlitem.para: Verify that the RVA measurement on the EICAS EPCS page reads 0 +/- 2.0 for the PRI and SEC channels of both EECs.
Move the EEC POWER switch to the NORM position.
Stow thrust reverser, if deployed, per AMM 78-31-00, Manually (Stow) Retract the Thrust Reverser, or Retract (Stow) the Thrust Reverser with Hydraulic Power.

note.para: The ground maintenance thrust reverser deactivation procedure must first be accomplished prior to manually stowing the thrust reverser. The AMM CAUTION to not use the ground maintenance deactivation procedure for flight dispatch is appropriate because the procedure is used only while manually stowing the thrust reverser. After manually stowing the thrust reverser, the thrust reverser activation procedure must be accomplished before proceeding with the following DDG deactivation procedural steps.

numlitem.para: Open aft fairing access door.
Obtain isolation valve deactivation pin B78001-3 (part of B78001-2 Dispatch Kit) from the nacelle stowage location or the fly-away equipment stowage container in the forward cargo compartment.
Install deactivation pin in the manual lockout hole on the thrust reverser isolation valve and install cotter pin or lockwire.
Remove mechanical deactivation pin from stowage hole on both translating sleeves of inoperative thrust reverser.
Remove plug from lockout hole on both translating sleeves of inoperative reverser and install in stowage hole.
Install mechanical deactivation pin in lockout hole of right translating sleeve of the inoperative thrust reverser. If pin cannot be installed continue with step 7A; otherwise proceed to step 8.

note.para: When installed, mechanical deactivation pin will protrude 0.83 ± 0.03 in. (20-22mm).

numlitem.para: Manually unlock the lower locking actuator on the right thrust reverser translating sleeve (Ref. AMM 78-31-00-2) and restrain the unlock lever in the unlocked position.
Depress the bypass valve handle on the thrust reverser isolation valve and install a streamered pin (0.125 inch diameter X 1.1 inch).
Insert 3/8 in. square drive into the external drive socket of the right translating sleeve.

caution.para: MAXIMUM TORQUE PERMITTED DURING MANUAL STOWAGE IS 165 POUND-INCHES (18.6 NM).

numlitem.para: Push the drive to engage, then crank counter-clockwise until 165 pound-inches (18.6 NM) torque is reached; release pressure. Install mechanical deactivation pin. (If necessary repeat step three times.)
Manually unlock the left translating sleeve locking actuator and restrain the unlock lever in the unlocked position.
Insert 3/8 in. square drive into the external drive socket of the left translating sleeve.
Push the drive to engage, then apply 160 ± 5 lb-in torque clockwise. Verify that the left translating sleeve does not deploy (slight movement is acceptable).
Remove the restraint from the left translating sleeve actuator unlock lever and allow it to return to the locked position.
Install mechanical deactivation pin in lockout hole of left translating sleeve of the inoperative thrust reverser. If pin cannot be installed continue with step 12A; otherwise proceed to step 13.
Insert 3/8 in. square drive into the external drive socket of the left translating sleeve.

caution.para: MAXIMUM TORQUE PERMITTED DURING MANUAL STOWAGE IS 165 POUND-INCHES (18.6 NM).

numlitem.para: Push the drive to engage, then crank counter-clockwise until 165 pound-inches (18.6 NM) torque is reached; release pressure. Install mechanical deactivation pin. (If necessary repeat step three times).
Remove the streamered pin from the bypass valve handle on the thrust reverser isolation valve allowing the valve to return to its normally closed position.
Close aft fairing access door.
Pull and collar the affected sync lock circuit breaker(s).
LH engine
On main power distribution P6: L ENG SYNC-LOCK CONTROL (6C12)
RH engine
On main power distribution P6: R ENG SYNC-LOCK CONTROL
ALTN (6D12)
On overhead circuit breaker panel P11: R ENG SYNC-LOCK
CONTROL (11K32)

sheet.title: THRUST REVERSER ACTUATOR MANUAL LOCK AND CRANK LOCATIONS
